title: Supreme Court Voices Doubts Over Suit Alleging Nestle, Cargill Liable for Child Slavery
sub_head: Ivory Coast plantations supply food makers with cocoa
body:
WASHINGTON—The Supreme Court appeared reluctant Tuesday to fully immunize American corporations for committing human-rights abuses overseas, but several justices expressed doubts over the lawsuit before them, which aims to hold Nestle USA Inc. and Cargill Inc. liable for the exploitation of child slaves on Ivory Coast plantations that supply the food makers with cocoa.
The case was the latest testing of the reach of the Alien Tort Statute, a law originally passed in 1789 to conform the new American Republic to the “law of...
